meanings.definition: The state of being condensed or compacted.
meanings.sent1: The pyknoses of the bookshelves made the room feel small.
meanings.sent2: The pyknoses of the soil made it difficult for the plants to grow deep roots.
meanings.sent3: The pyknoses of the suitcase made it a challenge to fit all the clothes inside.
meanings.sent4: The pyknoses of the crowd in the tiny room felt suffocating.
meanings.sent5: The pyknoses of the box made it seem heavier than it actually was.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming more dense or compact.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the pyknoses of the dough made it perfect for baking.
meanings.sent2: The pyknoses of the traffic increased as rush hour approached.
meanings.sent3: The pyknoses of the snowball grew as the kids rolled it down the hill.
meanings.sent4: The pyknoses of the conversation made it hard for others to join in.
meanings.sent5: The pyknoses of the clouds signaled an incoming storm.

meanings.definition: A condition of increased nuclear condensation in cells.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the pyknoses of the cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The pyknoses of the nucleus indicated a change in the cell's state.
meanings.sent3: The pyknoses of the cells under stress surprised the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The pyknoses of the genetic material hinted at a possible mutation.
meanings.sent5: The pyknoses of the cell structure revealed a significant transformation.
